title.text: Result Stages and the Lexicon : The Proper Treatment of Event Structure

abstractContent.text: I will argue in this paper that the standard notions of affectedness, change-of-state and result state are too coarse-grained, and will revise and enrich substantially their content, increasing their role in a compositional aspect construal procedure.

I will claim in particular that a proper theory of event structure requires that enriched result states should be lexically represented, and will base on them a computational treatment of event structure within a feature-structure-based lexicon.

introductionContent.text: Event structure is traditionally accounted for using two sets of notions : change-of-state / affectedness and incrementality.
I will examine both in this paper, determining their respective limitations, before proposing an alternative approach and the formal specifications fora computational implementation.
